ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Chains resists
ygData.msgSnippet: I actually noticed it two patches ago ..  as well the Necro s I know are complaining that the darkness line is mirroring the problems.  Considered comparing
ygData.messageBody:
I actually noticed it two patches ago .. as well the Necro's I know are
complaining that the
darkness line is mirroring the problems. Considered comparing notes with
Necros on same mobs?

As well using Denon/Chain/Fear .. was noticing the dot come off and chain
when the mob got into
any odd pathing (esp. in Kunark).

I have my Bard on semi-hold until they are done looking at us ;)

- Menuette, Luclin

----- Original Message -----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas) <garramone@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, June 17, 2000 11:39 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Chains resists


> yes i know this come up after every patch, no i haven't done any formal
> testing =) but has anyone noticed an increase in chains resists?
possibly
> from them still tinkering with it? i can understand the krup frogs and
> higher giving me problems in sebilis, but the sepsis scarabs and the bok
> knights and even lower have been resisting chains an insane amount in the
> last couple days. i had 2 group members die on 2 different occassions
> because i could not get it to stick, and have been getting 3 to 5 straight
> resists very commonly on bok and even lower in sebilis. this is why i
> notice. i have never claimed the "resists are up, the patch nerfed
> something!" problem before.
>
> on another note, i'd love a definitive answer to this question, as it
would
> allow me to start chaining sooner if i am the snarer in the group. i
group
> with a shaman a lot, and obviously the shaman is in charge of slowing the
> mob. so, if the shaman slows the mob, and i chain the mob after, will the
> chain cancel the shaman's slowdown? i usually wait til close to when the
> mob is going to run cause i don't want to cancel the slow. if i am not
> going to cancel it then i can start snaring earlier, since i have recently
> become accustomed to getting resisted a ton.
>
> Shada Powa, L55 Wood Elf Troubador
> Tyria Sarkin, L50 High Elf Wizard
> <Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Find out your risk for Diabetes and win one of 40 cash prizes.
> For every test taken, we'll donate a $1 for research.

with the subject submissions.
